description.en: The aim of this course is to provide information about Estonia, Tartu and Estonian culture and society through films (including documentaries) and museums in Tartu.
description.et: Kursuse jooksul külastatakse Tartus asuvaid muuseume ja vaadatakse nii dokumentaal- kui ka mängufilme.

objectives.en: In this course foreign students will get basic information about Estonia and Tartu, and Estonian culture and society.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda välisüliõpilastele algteadmisi Eestist ja Tartust ning Eesti kultuurist ja ühiskonnast.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the semester, the student acquires preliminary knowledge of Estonia and Tartu, and Estonian culture, by watching Estonian movies and visiting the museums of Tartu - the student is familiar with the main museums of Tartu and knows a collection of Estonian movies.
learning_outcomes.et: Õppeaine lõpuks omandab üliõpilane Eesti filme vaadates ja Tartu muuseume külastades esialgsed teadmised Eestist ja Tartust ning Eesti kultuurist - üliõpilane tunneb Tartu peamisi muuseume ja teab valitud eestikeelseid filme.

notes.et:
- The course is for foreign/visiting students only.

- The courses HVLC.09.052 and FLKE.03.121 are parallel; taking these courses simultaneously is impossible. Please choose and register for one, either HVLC.09.052 or FLKE.03.121.

- Classes start on the first week of the semester, NB! at 12.00 (not 12.15!).

- No phones, tablets, laptops, and eating during the films, please! Coffee, tea and other drinks are very welcome.

- The fee for the course is 25 euros and should be paid by the second week/class. This price includes the ticket (either a student ticket or a group ticket, whichever is the cheapest option) and guided excursion in English. If any money is left at the end of the course, it is equally divided by all students (not only the ones that missed some/certain visits). 

- The museum visits take place only when at least 18 students are in the course. Otherwise, museums will be replaced with movies. 
Museums (may change):
1. Estonian National Museum / Eesti Rahva Muuseum - Muuseumi tee 2, Tartu
2. The University of Tartu Museum / Tartu Ülikooli Muuseum - Lossi 25, Tartu
3. KGB Cells Museum / KGB kongide museum - Riia 15b, Tartu OR Eesti Spordi- ja Olümpiamuuseum / Estonian Sports and Olympic Museum - Rüütli 15
Visit more: https://visittartu.com/museums/

**
!  Please pay attention to the registration cancellation deadline in the course outline!

!  If you have concerns or special needs affecting your studies, please inform the lecturer at the beginning of the semester.
If necessary, contact the University of Tartu counselling centre: https://ut.ee/en/content/psychological-counselling 
Requiring special conditions at the end of the semester is not acceptable.

independent_work.et:
Terms:

· Participation in about 80% of classes; 3 absences are allowed.

· Handing in the assignments:

1) notes about the films/museums (approximately 5-10 sentences about each museum or film). Please don't write the film's summary but your thoughts about it: what you liked, what you didn't like, what your thoughts and emotions were during the film/museum visit, and how it affected you. Use your point of view and first-person style - "I ... / My ..."; analyse, do not describe. Please take notes weekly, preferably right after watching the film or visiting the museum, when your thoughts and emotions are the freshest.

2) freely chosen cultural event or encounter in Estonia (approximately 10-20 sentences) - be it a visit to a museum, any place/town in Estonia, attending an event (concert, theatre, etc) or something else related to Estonian culture. 

3) essay (about 1-1,5 pages, A4). The topic must be related to Estonia/Estonian culture and written from a personal point of view, reflecting your observations and experiences in Estonia/Tartu - no need to use any sources or references. 

The notes and the essay have to be sent by e-mail (katrin.janese@ut.ee) at the end of the course in ONE PDF file. Handwritten or scanned submissions are not accepted). The file name should include your name (for example, FirstnameSurname.pdf).

Due date: May 30

grade_preconditions.et:
Terms:
· Participation in about 80% of classes, 3 absences are allowed.

grade_evaluation.et:
Final result:
A, excellent: Up to 3 missed classes, at least 10 analytical notes (including the freely chosen event) and an analytical essay presented.
B, very good: Up to 3 missed classes, at least 9 analytical notes and an analytical essay presented.
C, good: Up to 3 missed classes, at least 9 descriptive or analytical notes and an analytical essay presented.
D, satisfactory: Up to 3 missed classes, at least 9 descriptive or analytical notes and descriptive essay presented.
E, poor: Up to 4 missed classes and at least 8 descriptive or analytical notes presented.
F, failed: More than 5 missed classes or up to 5 missed classes and less than 9 notes presented.
